alert.note: Alert for Lower Tangipahoa; Northern St. Tammany; Southeast St. Tammany; Southwestern St. Tammany (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 27 at 7:25AM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central St. Tammany and southeastern Tangipahoa Parishes through 815 AM CDT... At 725 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Madisonville, or 11 miles southwest of Covington, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Slidell, Covington, Abita Springs, Madisonville, Lacombe, Slidell Airport and W Lk Pontchartrain Buoy. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 264 and 265. Interstate 12 between mile markers 55 and 83. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until noon CDT for southeastern Louisiana...and southern Mississippi.

area.areaDesc: Lower Tangipahoa; Northern St. Tammany; Southeast St. Tammany; Southwestern St. Tammany
